title: ICE on nightly with associated constants

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
I've got an array defined as:-
```
impl<'a> GenerateFunctionBody<'a>
{
const Size: usize = 256;
const Array: [u8; Self::Size] =
[
...
];
}

This definition causes the ICE below. Replacing `Self::Size` with `256` causes the ICE to go away. Because this array is a very large constant, I've defined it in a separate file which is `include!("GenerateFunctionBody.constants.rs"); from a file which also contains a `impl<'a> GenerateFunctionBody<'a>` block. Rust is edition 2015.

```

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
```
